name: Pier House Guest House

reviews.text: . After an exciting ferry ride from Doolin, it was a wonderful sight that our accommodation was near at hand. Rooms at the Pier House are modern, clean and welcoming. Our room had a double and single bed with a large bathroom with shower and a view of the pier from the window. There is no elevator and there are 13 rooms at the guest house. You are walking distance to the Aran Sweater Shop, a bike rental business, grocery and other amenities you would find in a village.There are tours of the island available by van, or the island can be explored on your own. A full Irish breakfast is included with your stay with lots of choices available. Thank you for a great first night in Ireland.
reviews.title: welcome spot for our first night in Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Pier House in Kilronan for our one night stay in Inishmore, because it had great reviews and because of its proximity to the ferry because we were leaving on the 8:15 am ferry back to Ros a Mhil. We arrived at about 11:30 am, and it was no surprise that our room was not ready yet. We were able to leave our bags in the guests' lounge, which didn't sit very well with me as I knew we would not be back for many hours as we explored the island and my iPad was in the bag. Needless to say, when we did return 7 hours later it was just as I had left it.
reviews.title: Simple and Comfortable

reviews.text: There are several bicycle hires right next to this B&B, as well as trap and pony rides and several bars and pubs, which overall made it a handy location. I will say that when you do rent a bike there, check your tires. Many of the tires are terribly worn and I thought that they would burst at any moment! Also, most of the seats you can just switch out... so look for one with a wider bottom ;)
reviews.title: Nothing was too much trouble

reviews.text: We had room 4 which directly faced the ferry pier and gave us a wide view of Galway bay. We had dinner in the restaurant at Pier House and the meal we had there that night was probably the best dinner we had in all of Ireland that week. My husband had the cod and I had the chicken. The vegetables that came with it were fresh and steamed and not riddled with butter or sauce. The bread we had there was also very, very good as well.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay

reviews.text: The only negative item regarding our stay was that the full breakfast service in the morning didn't start until after our ferry departure. A continental breakfast of cheeses, cereals and fruit was available to us that morning, however. If the dinner was as good as it was the night before, the Irish breakfast was sure to be sensational as well. We would return to Pier House on a future trip.
reviews.title: A great place from which to explore
A Base to Explore the Island
reviews.text: My wife and I spent one night here during a week long cycling trek of western Ireland. We thought is was a very good choice. It's literally right off the pier coming off the ferry which was handy as we had our bikes and luggage in tow. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very pleasant and well maintained. Unlike alot of hotels, it had some charm and a large bath. Very cozy and a nice view. The communal sitting room was inviting and comfotable. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was some of the best seafood we had on the trip. I had Monk Fish in Thai sauce and my wife had Cod. Both were excellant. The service was terrific and the setting enjoyable. The location is good and eveything you might need is close - other restaurants, bike rentals, shops, a large grocery and, of course, ice cream. It was a good experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guesthouse is in a great position facing the pier so you can't miss it. We arrived well before check-in time but there was no problem. There was a stunning view from the room. The room itself was clean(the shower could do with being replaced though) and the beds were comfortable..although we spent very little time in the room due to the fantastic weather! The information folder in the room makes it very clear that they do not tolerate noise...no hens and stags allowed!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have dinner in the restaurant but it was very busy when we returned that evening.We did have breakfast the following day which consisted of a small selection of cereals, youghurts, fruit, smoked salmon and brown bread.The obligatory 'Full Irish' was also on offer. There are several bike hire outlets very close to the guesthouse and this is the perfect way to see the island.For those who do not wish to cycle there were horse and traps for hire across from guesthouse and also minibuses.
reviews.title: Perfect End To An Easter Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The very well stocked supermarket is only 5 minutes walk away. Plus there are a few pubs close by. We booked directly though the guesthouse and were charged €45 per person for 1 night in June 2012
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming guest house w a great view of the sea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked this B&B before the last review and upon reading it we were a little nervous, however we were quickly put at ease on arrival. It was so easy to find and such a convenient location just of the boat. We were checked in by an older lady who was very friendly and accommodating. The room was warm and cosy and exactly what we wanted to fit in with the atmosphere for the Aran Islands, and the view from the room was lovely.We spent the day exploring the Island by bike and visited Dun Aengus which was AMAZING. Next morning we had breakfast before getting the boat and I had a traditional Irish breakfast which was delicious and hit the spot. My partner had a selection from the great spread from the continental breakfast, her favourite were the cheeses.Really enjoyable and relaxing end to our Easter break would really recommend.
reviews.title: Lovely Weekend

reviews.text: I have 2 different points to tell about this place. Firstly when we arrived to the guest house, after a very rough crossing we both felt a bit ill. We asked for 2 cans coke just to try and get some life back into us. We got them alright but it cost us 5 EURO for 2 cans of coke !!!! . Secondly I had booked this guest house before we made the trip and was quoted 60 euro for the night. The following morning when I went to pay he tried to charge me 80 euro, I told him I was quoted 60 but he was adamint he wanted 80. We had a bit of a heated discussion about it but in the end he accepted the 60 euro. I Know the island depends on tourists to survive but this is just a blatent RIP OFF.
reviews.title: RIP OFF !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pier hotel was convenient, clean, warm (on a wet, windy and cold day), the staff were very friendly and helpful and we had a good stay. Everything in the hotel was clean and tidy.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable country pub

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were a bit cramped, with a view of a seedy back yard. This is the real Ireland, way out on the west coast: expect friendly welcome and good humor from all the locals, really interesting island but things are obviously a bit tough in the economy. Local history is amazing, well worth the trip.
reviews.title: Loved it! Stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Must do: the prehistoric fort of Dun Angusa.
reviews.title: September 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable and relaxing. Excellent location as you step off the ferry and convenient to shopping, tours vans, bikes and pony carts. Rooms were comfortable and clean. We especially enjoyed the private parlour for guests only with a peat fire and wonderful views of the harbour. Only a 15 minute walk from Joe Watty's Pub with traditional Irish music sessions beginning at 10 pm. The food at Pier House was very good.
reviews.title: Easy and Welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only bad thing I can say about this place was that when I asked for room availability through email the day before we planned to check-in, the rate I was given was 40 euros each. But we also went there personally to check in and was told the rate is 45 euros. Didn't check my email until we have paid the bill. But overall, it was a very convenient place to be. Near the shops and restaurants and the pier. And the facilities in the room was to our liking; what with toiletries, extra pillows and blankets and tea making facilities (my hubby was ecstatic about the latter). They even kept our beer cold for us while we finished our trekking. The view from our window wasn't entirely the best, but you could still smell and feel the breeze from the ocean and we slept with the window open and I have to admit, it did wonders for my asthma. The breakfast was great too. One of the best croissant I had in a long time. I wished we stayed here for 2 nights rather than wasting the 1st night with the pink B&B.
reviews.title: worth the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one nite.
reviews.title: Well worth a Visit
Disappointing
reviews.text: Ideal location on the island, friendly and welcoming staff.
Nice restaurant attached to it.
reviews.title: Not a Family Room

reviews.text: No complaints about the room, spacious and comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic place with a great view!

aka: Pier House Guest House Hotel Inishmore
